warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles, gradually increasing the size. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds each direction.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Alternate between arching your back (cat) and dropping your belly (cow). Perform 2 sets of 10 reps.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hands on hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Twist your torso to the left and right, keeping your hips stable. Perform 2 sets of 15 reps each side.

exercises.setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
execution: 1. Grip the bar with a wide grip, palms facing forward.
2. Sit with your back straight and feet flat on the floor.
3. Pull the bar down towards your upper chest, keeping your elbows pointed down and back.
4. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 10-12 reps with good form, typically around 60-70% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the bar with a neutral grip, palms facing each other.
2. Sit with your back straight and feet flat on the floor.
3. Pull the bar down towards your upper chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
4. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with proper form, similar to the wide grip version.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on engaging your lats throughout the movement. Avoid using momentum to pull the bar down.

exercises.setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
execution: 1. Grip the bar with a neutral grip, palms facing each other.
2. Sit with your back straight and feet flat on the floor.
3. Pull the bar down towards your upper chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
4. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 10-12 reps with good form, typically around 60-70% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Stand under a pull-up bar and grab it with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and shoulders relaxed.
2. Pull your body up until your chin clears the bar, focusing on engaging your back muscles.
3. Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Use body weight or add weight if needed to complete 10-12 reps.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your core engaged to prevent swinging. Focus on a smooth, controlled movement.

exercises.exercise_name: Half Kneeling One Arm Lat Pull Down
exercises.setup: Kneel on one knee and brace against a bench or your knee for stability.
execution: 1. Grip the handle with one hand, palm facing forward.
2. Pull the cable down towards your side, focusing on driving your elbow down.
3. Squeeze your lat at the bottom of the movement.
4. Slowly return to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 10-12 reps per arm with good form, typically around 60-70% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Stand facing a cable machine with a straight bar attached to the high pulley.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the bar with both hands, palms facing down.
2. Pull the bar down in an arc motion towards your thighs, keeping your arms straight.
3. Squeeze your lats at the bottom of the movement.
4. Slowly return to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10-12 reps with proper form, focusing on the stretch and contraction of the lats.
exercises.additional_tips: Ensure your core is engaged to maintain stability. Focus on a smooth, controlled movement.
